channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for LA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for LA

item.title: Report E-2024090091
item.description:
Report E-2024090091

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-08T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-29
  • City: HAMMOND
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 10ft-by-40ft area of the trailer floor and concrete lot under the trailer and estimated that fifty-five (55) gallons of material was released due to pallet puncturing one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. Clean Harbors personnel neutralized the impacted area and containerized the recovered material into four (4) 55-gallon poly drums along with impacted pallet pieces and the damaged drum was overpacked into one (1) 95-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024090067
item.description:
Report E-2024090067

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-08T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-31
  • City: SCOTT
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO contacted ERTS to report a spill. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and dispatched a contractor to assist with cleanup. The contractor arrived onsite and reported approximately 1-gallon of product released from a metal tote impacting a 3’x3’ area of the trailer floor. The contractor transferred the remaining material in the damaged tote into a new tote, deployed oil dri and absorbent pads to the impacted trailer floor. The recovered oil dri, absorbent pads, and PPE were containerized into one (1) 35-gallon poly drum. The damaged empty tote was sent back to the shipper.
